p: A positive attitude toward control of COVID-19 was seen in a majority (71.5%). A good proportion of participants (31.5%) thought that they had a greater chance of getting COVID-19 than the general population because of their comorbidity (rheumatic disease), and 18.9% believed that the antirheumatic medications they were taking could increase their susceptibility to infection. Responses on the attitude domain are given in Table 3.
